intro: Lupinaster lemmonii, commonly known as the Lemmon's lupinaster, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume-like pods and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, adding visual interest to its habitat. Lupinaster lemmonii plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological balance in its native range.
